parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To wake out of sleep, arouse in general, stir up. From dia and egeiro; to wake fully; i.e. Arouse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Master, teacher, chief, commander. From epi and a presumed derivative of histemi; an appointee over, i.e. Commander.
Master, teacher, chief, commander. From epi and a presumed derivative of histemi; an appointee over, i.e. Commander.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To wake out of sleep, arouse in general, stir up. From dia and egeiro; to wake fully; i.e. Arouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Rough water, a wave, billow, surge. From kluzo; a surge of the sea.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A calm. Of uncertain derivation; tranquillity.
